docs.lead_paragraph: Planned Parenthood Arizona filed an appeal Tuesday after a federal judge refused to temporarily block the nation's most stringent restrictions on the use of abortion drugs.

headline.main: Planned Parenthood Appeals Over New Abortion Rules
headline.print_headline: Planned Parenthood Appeals Over New Abortion Rules

docs.snippet: Planned Parenthood Arizona filed an appeal Tuesday after a federal judge refused to temporarily block the nation's most stringent restrictions on the use of abortion drugs.

docs.lead_paragraph: What you need to know to start your day: Big Business grilled on the Hill, a White House victory lap, and an iBirthday.
docs.snippet: What you need to know to start your day: Big Business grilled on the Hill, a White House victory lap, and an iBirthday.

byline.original: By ADEEL HASSAN and VICTORIA SHANNON

docs.lead_paragraph: The rules, which were approved by the Arizona Legislature in 2012 and will take effect on Tuesday, restrict the use of medication to induce abortions during the early stages of pregnancy.

headline.main: Judge Won’t Block Rules on Abortion Drug in Arizona
headline.print_headline: Judge Won’t Block Rules on Abortion Drug

docs.abstract: Federal Judge David C Bury refuses to block Arizona rules on limiting the use of abortion drugs; Planned Parenthood believes new restrictions will force many women to undergo unnecessary surgical abortions and prevent some women from getting an abortion at all.
docs.snippet: The rules, which were approved by the Arizona Legislature in 2012 and will take effect on Tuesday, restrict the use of medication to induce abortions during the early stages of pregnancy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The superfluous bone, seen in fossil samples, was a sign of inbreeding and harsh conditions during pregnancy.

headline.main: In Extra Rib, a Harbinger of Mammoth’s Doom
headline.print_headline: Fossils: In Extra Rib, a Harbinger of Mammoth’s Doom

docs.abstract: Study in journal PeerJ reports that many woolly mammoths from North Sea had superfluous rib attached to seventh vertebra, sign that they suffered from inbreeding and harsh conditions during pregnancy; anomaly may have contributed to their extinction 12,000 to 10,000 years ago.
docs.snippet: The superfluous bone, seen in fossil samples, was a sign of inbreeding and harsh conditions during pregnancy.
